body: Have you tried using one of the `bento` boxes (like `"bento/ubuntu-17.10"`)? I'm curious if that would work for you. Thanks!

I'm having exactly the same issue. I will try if it is better with your suggested `bento/ubuntu-17.10` version. I'm on Windows 10 Pro Insider Preview, Build 17074. Mine is also with hyperv provider...
No, using the bento box didn't make the problem go away for me.

@AnthonyMastrean @pieterbreed Hi! I'm trying to reproduce this error and have so far been unsuccessful in generating an exact reproduction. I have been able to force an error by allocating more memory to the guest than the host is able to provide, but the error message I receive is different than yours. If you configure the memory to a lower value (like `"1024"`) do you still receive the same error? 

Thanks!

OK, so it's been a while and I've updated to Windows 10 Pro 1803 (not that I think that made any difference). I get the same or similar error, unless I also set `maxmemory >= memory`! I wonder if this isn't a fundamental bug? Maybe Vagrant can do some parsing of the options and check or ensure that this `maxmemory` setting is appropriate?

issue.title: Validate maxmemory setting within Hyper-V provider

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
Forces an error if maxmemory value is less than the configured
minimum or startup memory.

Fixes #9477

body: Same here with Vagrant 2.1.2 and  Windows 10 Pro 1803

Same here with Vagrant 2.2.0 on Windows Server 2012R2 and box generic/debian9.

To reproduce the error, `vagrant init` a new instance, set memory to something higher than 2048 and omit setting maxmemory.
example:
```
Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  #config.vm.box = "debian/stretch64" # does not support provider hyperv
  config.vm.box = "generic/debian9"
  config.vm.provider "hyperv" do |h|
    h.memory = 4096
    # h.maxmemory = 4096
  end
end
```
To fix the error, set memory to something higher than 2048 and set maxmemory to the same.
example:
```
Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  #config.vm.box = "debian/stretch64" # does not support provider hyperv
  config.vm.box = "generic/debian9"
  config.vm.provider "hyperv" do |h|
    h.memory = 4096
    h.maxmemory = 4096
  end
end
```

issue.title: Cannot configure Hyper-V box memory more than 2048mb without setting maxmemory

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
### Vagrant version
2.2.0

### Host operating system
Windows Server 2012 R2 [Version 6.3.9600] (German)

### Guest operating system
[generic/debian9](https://app.vagrantup.com/generic/boxes/debian9)

### Vagrantfile
```ruby
Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  #config.vm.box = "debian/stretch64" # does not support provider hyperv
  config.vm.box = "generic/debian9"
  config.vm.provider "hyperv" do |h|
    h.memory = 4096
    # h.maxmemory = 4096
  end
end
```

### Debug output
https://gist.github.com/vchrizz/8730697b9d4323c5ed4d16a2b2e3e704

### Expected behavior
Vagrant machine should start with the defined memory set.

### Actual behavior
`vagrant up` fails with an error about maxmemory setting:
```
An error occurred while executing a PowerShell script. This error
is shown below. Please read the error message and see if this is
a configuration error with your system. If it is not, then please
report a bug.

Script: configure_vm.ps1
Error:

Failed to configure memory: Maximum memory value is less than required minimum memory value.
```

### Steps to reproduce
1. vagrant init
2. edit `Vagrantfile` and set `memory` more than 2048
3. do NOT set `maxmemory` (setting this to same amount as `memory` 'fixes' the issue.
4. `vagrant up`

### References
- GH-9477

body:
I'm going to lock this issue because it has been closed for _30 days_ . This helps our maintainers find and focus on the active issues.

If you have found a problem that seems similar to this, please open a new issue and complete the issue template so we can capture all the details necessary to investigate further.
